intro: Microtis cupularis, commonly known as the cupular microtis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in heathland or open forests. Microtis cupularis is a perennial herb that produces a single spike of flowers, making it a distinctive and ornamental species.
